info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:13AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Christian, southern Shelby, southwestern Cumberland, northwestern Clay and Effingham Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Pana to Brownstown to near Salem. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Altamont and Beecher City around 1125 AM CDT. Shelbyville around 1130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Effingham, Stewardson, Edgewood, Shumway, Iola and Watson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 143 and 172. Interstate 70 between mile markers 79 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
